main event: Sighting of a saucer-shaped light, vertical in form, larger than the moon, and very bright, observed for 20 minutes.
interesting points: The object changed shape and size during the observation, starting as a basketball-sized light and diminishing to the size of a pea at arm's length before disappearing.
The object changed from a single light to five grouped objects that seemed to merge as they disappeared.
The object performed a series of 8-10 abrupt 90-degree changes in direction during the 30-minute observation period.
The object was observed to be low on the horizon initially and disappear into the northeast, also low on the horizon.
The observer was an engineer with previous experience in the military and had no explanation for the sighting.
sighted object: saucer-shaped light, vertical in form, larger than the moon, and very bright
witnesses: civilian contractor-builder, former P-24 aircraft engineer and 2nd Electronic Experimental Squadron member
